intro: Siphocampylus lantanifolius var. glabriusculus, commonly known as the smoothleaf siphocampylus, is a rare flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are typically smooth and hairless. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pale yellow. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is often found in dry, arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species.
